one.title: FIRST DAY: Read the notes and the references.

questions.questionText: 1. Use this space to record how you have seen God's activity during the week. (How has He provided, answered, comforted, reconciled, guided, etc.?)
2. What from the notes, lecture, group sharing or personal study impacted you most in the past week?

two.title:
SECOND DAY: Read 1 Samuel 28.
Saul secretly consulted a medium for help.

questions.questionText: 3. What fears might David and Saul had about the battle? How did their fears influence their behavior?
4. What is wrong with consulting a medium? How do you respond when a friend or superior asks you to participate in an unethical situation? (See Leviticus 19:31 and 1 Chronicles 10:13-14.)
5. Where do you turn when it seems the Lord is silent or not telling you want you want to hear?

three.title:
THIRD DAY: Read 1 Samuel 29.
David was released from fighting against Israel.

questions.questionText: 6. What conflict arose between Achish and his men?
7. How do you see God at work in David's situation?
8. How have you seen God's protection in your own life?

four.title:
FOURTH DAY: Read 1 Samuel 30 with Psalm 36.
David and his men defeated the Amalekites and shared the plunder.

questions.questionText: 9. Describe the scene at Ziklag. How did David and his men respond?
10. What leadership qualities do you see in David? Which ones will you ask the Lord to develop in you?

five.title:
FIFTH DAY: Read 1 Samuel 31 with 1 Chronicles 10.
Saul took his own life.

questions.questionText: 12. Describe the events surrounding Saul's death. Who took care of the bodies of Saul and his sons? (See 1 Samuel 11:1-11.)
13. How might God be calling you to go out of your way to do something honorable or compassionate?
14. What was the summation of Saul's life? What do you hope will be said of you in relation to the Lord at the end of your life? (See 1 Chronicles 10:13-14.)

six.title: SIXTH DAY: Review 1 Samuel 28-31 with 1 Chronicles 10, and Psalm 36.

questions.questionText: 15. How did this week's study impact your thinking about the necessity to seek and trust God's guidance rather than looking to the world for wisdom?
